introText: With this test, you can assess your company’s compliance with the obligations of the joint controller. Once you have replied, you will receive a report summarising your feedback on your responses as well as recommendations on the measures to be taken in accordance with them. Remember that the joint controller will also be subject to other controller’s tests in the Data Protection Tool.

questions.question: Have you agreed with the joint controller on how the rights of the data subjects will be implemented in relation to the joint processing of personal data?

choices.selectedText: The joint controllers shall agree on how the rights of data subjects will be implemented in practice. The division of tasks may be, for example, that one of the controllers is designated as a contact point and is responsible for the execution of data subjects’ requests on behalf of both controllers. There is no need to conclude a contract on the division of responsibilities, but the arrangement must be documented and its main elements must be indicated to the data subjects, for example in the privacy statement. Read more: https://tietosuoja.fi/en/rights-of-the-data-subject
choices.selectedActions: Great! Make sure that the division of responsibilities is kept up to date if there are changes to the processing of personal data.

questions.question: Have you agreed with the joint controller on how the requirement to inform data subjects will be implemented with regard to the joint processing of personal data?

choices.selectedText: The joint controllers shall jointly agree on how the requirement to inform data subjects will be implemented in practice. The division of tasks may be, for example, that one of the controllers ensures that data subjects receive all the information required by the GDPR concerning the processing of personal data (e.g. by drawing up a privacy statement). Read more about the obligations concerning the provision of information to data subjects: https://tietosuoja.fi/rekisteroidyn-informointi

questions.question: Have you agreed with the joint controller on how the other GDPR obligations will be implemented with regard to the joint processing of personal data?

choices.selectedText: In addition to dividing tasks related to data subjects’ rights and information obligations, joint controllers must define responsibilities for complying with other obligations laid down in the GDPR. Making a contract about them is not mandatory, but the arrangement must be documented. The joint controller must agree on the division of responsibilities, for example, on how the data security of the systems or the erasure of personal data will be ensured. You will receive more information about the obligations of the controller by completing the other surveys intended for the controller.

This report has been generated on the basis of a data protection self-assessment for SMEs at https://tietosuojaapkyrityksille.fi/en

The purpose of the report generated by the tool is to give tips and recommendations. You still need to read and understand the General Data Protection Regulation, and compliance with the report's instructions does not guarantee compliance with the GDPR. Every SME is different and requires unique data protection measures. This tool cannot replace such measures, but is only intended to support them.
